Inchmaree Clause.definition: a clause in a marine insurance policy that covers damage or loss caused by the negligence of a vessel's own captain or crew or by any defect in the ship's hull or machinery
Inchmaree Clause.origin: [after Inchmaree , a British steamer whose 1884 sinking in Liverpool harbor resulted in its formulation]

1.1: a clause in a marine insurance policy that covers damage or loss caused by the negligence of a vessel's own captain or crew or by any defect in the ship's hull or machinery
